member.name: N:Microsoft.CSharp.RuntimeBinder
member.summary: The namespace provides classes and interfaces that support interoperation between Dynamic Language Runtime and C#.

member.name: N:Microsoft.VisualBasic
member.summary: The namespace contains types that support the Visual Basic Runtime in Visual Basic.

member.name: N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices
member.summary: The namespace contains internal-use only types that support the Visual Basic compiler.

member.name: N:System
member.summary: The namespace contains fundamental classes and base classes that define commonly-used value and reference data types, events and event handlers, interfaces, attributes, and processing exceptions.

member.name: N:System.CodeDom.Compiler
member.summary: The namespace contains types for managing the generation and compilation of source code in supported programming languages. Code generators can each produce source code in a particular programming language based on the structure of Code Document Object Model (CodeDOM) source code models consisting of elements provided by the namespace.

member.name: N:System.Collections
member.summary: The namespace contains interfaces and classes that define various collections of objects, such as lists, queues, bit arrays, hash tables and dictionaries.

member.name: N:System.Collections.Concurrent
member.summary: The System.Collections.Concurrent namespace provides several thread-safe collection classes that should be used in place of the corresponding types in the and namespaces whenever multiple threads are accessing the collection concurrently.

member.name: N:System.Collections.Generic
member.summary: The namespace contains interfaces and classes that define generic collections, which allow users to create strongly typed collections that provide better type safety and performance than non-generic strongly typed collections.

member.name: N:System.Collections.ObjectModel
member.summary: The namespace contains classes that can be used as collections in the object model of a reusable library. Use these classes when properties or methods return collections.

member.name: N:System.Collections.Specialized
member.summary: The namespace contains specialized and strongly-typed collections; for example, a linked list dictionary, a bit vector, and collections that contain only strings.

member.name: N:System.ComponentModel
member.summary: The namespace provides classes that are used to implement the run-time and design-time behavior of components and controls. This namespace includes the base classes and interfaces for implementing attributes and type converters, binding to data sources, and licensing components.

member.name: N:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations
member.summary: The namespace provides attribute classes that are used to define metadata for ASP.NET MVC and ASP.NET data controls.

member.name: N:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.Schema
member.summary: The namespace provides support for attribute classes that are used to define metadata for ASP.NET MVC and ASP.NET data controls.

member.name: N:System.Diagnostics
member.summary: The namespace provides classes that allow you to interact with system processes, event logs, and performance counters.

member.name: N:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis
member.summary: The namespace contains classes for interaction with code analysis tools. These tools are used to analyze code for conformance to coding conventions such as naming or security rules.

member.name: N:System.Diagnostics.Contracts
member.summary: The namespace contains static classes for representing program contracts such as preconditions, postconditions, and invariants.

member.name: N:System.Diagnostics.Tracing
member.summary: The namespace provides types and members that enable you to create strongly typed events to be captured by event tracing for Windows (ETW).

member.name: N:System.Dynamic
member.summary: The namespace provides classes and interfaces that support Dynamic Language Runtime.

member.name: N:System.Globalization
member.summary: The namespace contains classes that define culture-related information, including language, country/region, calendars in use, format patterns for dates, currency, and numbers, and sort order for strings. These classes are useful for writing globalized (internationalized) applications. Classes such as and provide advanced globalization functionalities, including surrogate support and text element processing.

member.name: N:System.IO
member.summary: The System.IO namespace contains types that allow reading and writing to files and data streams, and types that provide basic file and directory support.

member.name: N:System.IO.Compression
member.summary: The namespace contains classes that provide basic compression and decompression services for streams.

member.name: N:System.Linq
member.summary: The namespace provides classes and interfaces that support queries that use Language-Integrated Query (LINQ).

member.name: N:System.Linq.Expressions
member.summary: The namespace contains classes, interfaces and enumerations that enable language-level code expressions to be represented as objects in the form of expression trees.

member.name: N:System.Net
member.summary: The namespace provides a simple programming interface for many of the protocols used on networks today. The and classes form the basis of what are called pluggable protocols, an implementation of network services that enables you to develop applications that use Internet resources without worrying about the specific details of the individual protocols.Classes in the namespace can be used to develop Windows Store apps or desktop apps. When used in a Windows Store app, classes in the namespace are affected by network isolation feature, part of the application security model used by the Windows Developer Preview. The appropriate network capabilities must be enabled in the app manifest for a Windows Store app for the system to allow network access by a Windows Store app. For more information, see the Network Isolation for Windows Store Apps.

member.name: N:System.Net.Http
member.summary: The namespace provides a programming interface for modern HTTP applications.

member.name: N:System.Net.Http.Headers
member.summary: Provides support for collections of HTTP headers used by the namespace

member.name: N:System.Net.NetworkInformation
member.summary: The namespace provides access to network traffic data, network address information, and notification of address changes for the local computer. The namespace also contains classes that implement the Ping utility. You can use and related classes to check whether a computer is reachable across the network.

member.name: N:System.Numerics
member.summary: The namespace contains numeric types that complement the numeric primitives, such as , , and , that are defined by the .NET Framework.

member.name: N:System.Reflection
member.summary: The namespace contains types that retrieve information about assemblies, modules, members, parameters, and other entities in managed code by examining their metadata. These types also can be used to manipulate instances of loaded types, for example to hook up events or to invoke methods. To dynamically create types, use the namespace.

member.name: N:System.Reflection.Context
member.summary: The namespace contains classes that enable customized reflection contexts.

member.name: N:System.Reflection.Emit
member.summary: The namespace contains classes that allow a compiler or tool to emit metadata and Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) and optionally generate a PE file on disk. The primary clients of these classes are script engines and compilers.

member.name: N:System.Resources
member.summary: The namespace provides classes and interfaces that allow developers to create, store, and manage various culture-specific resources used in an application. One of the most important classes of the namespace is the class.

member.name: N:System.Runtime
member.summary: The namespace contains advanced types that support diverse namespaces such as the System, Runtime, and the Security namespaces.

member.name: N:System.Runtime.CompilerServices
member.summary: The namespace provides functionality for compiler writers who use managed code to specify attributes in metadata that affect the run-time behavior of the common language runtime.

member.name: N:System.Runtime.ExceptionServices
member.summary: The namespace provides classes for advanced exception handling.

member.name: N:System.Runtime.InteropServices
member.summary: The namespace provides a wide variety of members that support COM interop and platform invoke services. If you are unfamiliar with these services, see Interoperating with Unmanaged Code.

member.name: N:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes
member.summary: The System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes namespace contains methods that are defintions of COM functions for managed code. These functions replace the now-obsolete UCOM* methods in the namespace.

member.name: N:System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime
member.summary: The namespace contains classes that support interoperation between managed code and the Windows Runtime, and that enable the creation of Windows Runtime types with managed code.

member.name: N:System.Runtime.Serialization
member.summary: The namespace contains classes that can be used for serializing and deserializing objects. Serialization is the process of converting an object or a graph of objects into a linear sequence of bytes for either storage or transmission to another location. Deserialization is the process of taking in stored information and recreating objects from it.

member.name: N:System.Runtime.Serialization.Json
member.summary: Provides classes related to Json serialization.

member.name: N:System.Runtime.Versioning
member.summary: The namespace contains advanced types that support versioning in side by side implementations of the .NET Framework.

member.name: N:System.Security
member.summary: The namespace provides the underlying structure of the common language runtime security system, including base classes for permissions.

member.name: N:System.Security.Principal
member.summary: The namespace defines a principal object that represents the security context under which code is running. For more information, see Role-Based Security.

member.name: N:System.ServiceModel
member.summary: Provides classes related to the service model.

member.name: N:System.ServiceModel.Channels
member.summary: Provides classes related to service model channels.

member.name: N:System.ServiceModel.Description
member.summary: Provides classes related to the service model description.

member.name: N:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher
member.summary: Provides classes related to dispatching the service model.

member.name: N:System.ServiceModel.Security
member.summary: The namespace deals with general security-related topics, for example, .

member.name: N:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens
member.summary: Deals with security tokens and certificates.

member.name: N:System.Text
member.summary: The namespace contains classes that represent ASCII and Unicode character encodings; abstract base classes for converting blocks of characters to and from blocks of bytes; and a helper class that manipulates and formats objects without creating intermediate instances of .

member.name: N:System.Text.RegularExpressions
member.summary: The namespace contains classes that provide access to the .NET Framework regular expression engine. The namespace provides regular expression functionality that may be used from any platform or language that runs within the Microsoft .NET Framework. In addition to the types contained in this namespace, the class enables you to determine whether a particular string conforms to a regular expression pattern.

member.name: N:System.Threading
member.summary: The namespace provides classes and interfaces that enable multithreaded programming. In addition to classes for synchronizing thread activities and access to data (, , , , and so on), this namespace includes a class that allows you to use a pool of system-supplied threads, and a class that executes callback methods on thread pool threads.

member.name: N:System.Threading.Tasks
member.summary: The System.Threading.Tasks namespace provides types that simplify the work of writing concurrent and asynchronous code. The main types are which represents an asynchronous operation that can be waited on and cancelled, and , which is a task that can return a value. The class provides static methods for creating and starting tasks, and the class provides the default thread scheduling infrastructure.

member.name: N:System.Windows.Input
member.summary: Provides types to support the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) input system. This includes device abstraction classes for mouse, keyboard, and stylus devices, a common input manager class, support for commanding and custom commands, and various utility classes.

member.name: N:System.Xml
member.summary: The namespace provides standards-based support for processing XML.

member.name: N:System.Xml.Linq
member.summary: Contains the classes for LINQ to XML. LINQ to XML is an in-memory XML programming interface that enables you to modify XML documents efficiently and easily.

member.name: N:System.Xml.Schema
member.summary: The namespace contains the XML classes that provide standards-based support for XML schema definition language (XSD) schemas.

member.name: N:System.Xml.Serialization
member.summary: The namespace contains classes that are used to serialize objects into XML format documents or streams.

member.name: N:Windows.Foundation
member.summary: The namespace contains types that support the development of Windows Store apps with the .NET Framework.

member.name: N:Windows.UI
member.summary: The namespace contains types that support the development of Windows Store apps with the .NET Framework.

member.name: N:Windows.UI.Xaml
member.summary: The namespace contains types that support the development of Windows Store apps with the .NET Framework.

member.name: N:Windows.UI.Xaml.Automation
member.summary: The namespace contains types that support the development of Windows Store apps with the .NET Framework.

member.name: N:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives
member.summary: The namespace contains types that support the development of Windows Store apps with the .NET Framework.

member.name: N:Windows.UI.Xaml.Markup
member.summary: The namespace contains types that support the development of Windows Store apps with the .NET Framework.

member.name: N:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media
member.summary: The namespace contains types that support the development of Windows Store apps with the .NET Framework.

member.name: N:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation
member.summary: The namespace contains types that support the development of Windows Store apps with the .NET Framework.

member.name: N:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Media3D
member.summary: The namespace contains types that support the development of Windows Store apps with the .NET Framework.
